Class Board

java.lang.Object
fr.uge.cascadia.board.Board
public class Board extends Object
The Board class represents the game board for a player. It manages the grid of tiles and tracks the tiles that have been placed. This version handles both square and hexagonal tiles.
Author:
Massinissa

  • Constructor Details

    • Board

      public Board(int size, TileType type)
      Constructs a new game board with a specified size and tile type.
      Parameters:
      size - The size of the board grid. Must be between 1 and 20.
      type - The type of tiles to be used on the board (Square or Hexagonal).
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the size is not a positive integer or exceeds 20.
      NullPointerException - If the tile type is null.

  • Method Details

    • getGrid

      public ArrayList<ArrayList<Tile>> getGrid()
      Gets the grid of the board.
      Returns:
      the grid as an ArrayList of ArrayLists of Tiles.

    • getInsertedTiles

      public Map<Tile,Position> getInsertedTiles()
      Gets the map of inserted tiles and their positions.
      Returns:
      a map with tiles as keys and their positions as values.

    • initializeBoard

      public void initializeBoard(int initialTilesIndex)
      Initializes the board by placing three initial tiles in the center of the grid.
      Parameters:
      initialTilesIndex - The index of the first tile to use from the bag of initial tiles.

    • isInBounds

      public boolean isInBounds(Position p)
      Verifies if a position is within the bounds of the grid.
      Parameters:
      p - the position to verify.
      Returns:
      true if the position is valid, false otherwise.

    • getValidPositions

      public List<Position> getValidPositions()
      Retrieves a list of valid positions on the board where a new tile can be placed. A position is considered valid if: - It is adjacent to at least one already inserted tile. - It is not already occupied by another tile. - It is within the bounds of the board.
      Returns:
      A list of valid positions where a tile can be placed.

    • getNeighbors

      public List<Position> getNeighbors(Position position)
      Retrieves the neighboring positions of a given position on the board. The type of neighbors (hexagonal or square) depends on the tile type of the board.
      Parameters:
      position - The position for which neighbors are to be retrieved. Must not be null.
      Returns:
      A list of neighboring positions around the given point.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - If the point is null.

    • getSquareNeighbors

      public static List<Position> getSquareNeighbors(Position position)
      Retrieves the neighboring positions for a square grid. The neighbors are the positions directly adjacent to the given position (up, down, left, right).
      Parameters:
      position - The central position for which neighbors are to be retrieved. Must not be null.
      Returns:
      A list of positions representing the neighbors in a square grid.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - If the given position is null.

    • getHexagonalNeighbors

      public static List<Position> getHexagonalNeighbors(Position position)
      Retrieves the neighboring positions for a hexagonal grid. The neighbors are determined based on the current position in the grid and depend on whether the row number is even or odd.
      Parameters:
      position - The central position for which neighbors are to be retrieved. Must not be null.
      Returns:
      A list of positions representing the neighbors in a hexagonal grid.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - If the given point is null.

    • insertTile

      public boolean insertTile(Position p, Tile tile)
      Places a tile on the board at the specified position. Expands the grid size if necessary after the tile is inserted.
      Parameters:
      p - The position to place the tile. Must not be null.
      tile - The tile to insert. Must not be null.
      Returns:
      true if the tile was successfully inserted, false otherwise.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - If the position or tile is null.

    • addNatureToken

      public void addNatureToken()
      Increments the number of Nature Tokens for the player. Also increments the count of gained Nature Tokens used success tracking.

    • subtractNatureToken

      public void subtractNatureToken()
      Decrements the number of Nature Tokens if the current count is greater than zero.

    • getNatureTokens

      public int getNatureTokens()
      Returns the current number of Nature Tokens the player has.
      Returns:
      The number of Nature Tokens.

    • getGainedNatureTokens

      public int getGainedNatureTokens()
      Returns the number of Nature Tokens gained.
      Returns:
      The number of Nature Tokens.

    • insertToken

      public boolean insertToken(Position p, AnimalToken token)
      Inserts a token at a given position on the board.
      Parameters:
      p - the position where the token should be placed.
      token - the token to insert.
      Returns:
      true if the token was successfully inserted, false otherwise.

    • freePlaceForToken

      public boolean freePlaceForToken(AnimalToken token)
      Checks if there is at least one free place on the board for a given token.
      Parameters:
      token - the token to check.
      Returns:
      true if there is at least one free place for the token, false otherwise.

    • displayBoard

      public void displayBoard()
      Displays the board in the terminal. Square tiles are displayed; hexagonal tiles are skipped.

    • getType

      public TileType getType()
      Getter of the tileType used
      Returns:
      type , the type of the Tiles in the board

    • searchBiggestGroup

      public int searchBiggestGroup(int x, int y, Animal animal, boolean[][] visited)
      Recursively searches for the largest connected group of tiles that have the same animal token.
      Parameters:
      x - The x-coordinate of the starting position.
      y - The y-coordinate of the starting position.
      animal - The animal to search for in the group.
      visited - A 2D boolean array to track visited positions.
      Returns:
      The size of the largest connected group of tiles containing the specified animal.

    • getAnimalCount

      public int getAnimalCount(Animal animal)
      Counts the number of tiles on the board that have a token assigned to the specified animal.
      Parameters:
      animal - The animal to count on the board (must not be null).
      Returns:
      The total number of tiles containing a token of the specified animal.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - If the provided animal is null.

    • areAnimalsAdjacent

      public static boolean areAnimalsAdjacent(Board board, Animal animal1, Animal animal2)
      Checks if two specific animals are adjacent to each other on the board.
      Parameters:
      board - The game board to check
      animal1 - The first animal to check
      animal2 - The second animal to check
      Returns:
      true if the two animals are adjacent on the board, false otherwise.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - If the board, animal1, or animal2 is null.
